\n\nSince this is a git repository, the: Since this is a git repository, the update can be pulled directly.

Adjust an option by an amount relative t: Adjust an option by an amount relative to its current value. (Also outputs the new value, which may be constrained to some limits.)
Adjusts the center position of horizonta: Adjusts the center position of horizontal head tilt. Not recommended. Move the camera instead if possible.
Adjusts the center position of horizontal head tilt. This horizontal offset is not recommended. Move the camera instead if possible.

An error occurred while updating from gi: An error occurred while updating from git.
Automatically starts Tracky Mouse as soo: Automatically starts Tracky Mouse as soon as it's run.
Blends between using point tracking (2D):
Blends between using point tracking (2D) and detected head tilt (3D).
- At 0% it will use only point tracking. This moves the cursor according to visible movement of 2D points on your face within the camera's view, so it responds to both head rotation and translation.
- At 100% it will use only head tilt. This uses an estimate of your face's orientation in 3D space, and ignores head translation. Note that this is smoothed, so it's not as responsive as point tracking. In this mode you never need to recenter by pushing the cursor to the edge of the screen.
- In between it will behave like an automatic calibration, subtly adjusting the point tracking to match the head tilt. This works by slowing down mouse movement that is moving away from the position that would be expected based on the head tilt, and (only past 80% on the slider) actively moving towards it.
Change an option to a particular value. (Also outputs the new value, which may be constrained to some limits.)
Checked out %0. Restart the app to use t: Checked out %0. Restart the app to use the updated version.

Control your computer with your webcam.
Control your mouse hands-free. This CLI: Control your mouse hands-free. This CLI controls the running Tracky Mouse app. It's meant for external programs like a voice command system to toggle Tracky Mouse and adjust settings on the fly.
Controls how much you need to tilt your: Controls how much you need to tilt your head left or right to reach the edge of the screen.
Controls how much you need to tilt your head up or down to reach the edge of the screen.
Couldn't checkout the latest version in: Couldn't checkout the latest version in the local git repository. You may have uncommitted changes.
Determines whether cursor movement is ba: Determines whether cursor movement is based on 3D head tilt, or 2D motion of the face in the camera feed.
Disable clicking. Use with an external s: Disable clicking. Use with an external switch or programs that provide their own dwell clicking.
Failed to backup current settings before: Failed to backup current settings before import.
Failed to install dependencies for the n: Failed to install dependencies for the new version after checking it out from git.
Failed to parse known cameras from local: Failed to parse known cameras from localStorage:
Higher acceleration makes the cursor mov: Higher acceleration makes the cursor move faster when the head moves quickly, and slower when the head moves slowly.
Hold the cursor in place for a short tim: Hold the cursor in place for a short time to click.
How much you need to tilt your head left: How much you need to tilt your head left and right to reach the edges of the screen.
How much you need to tilt your head left or right to reach the edge of the screen.
How much you need to tilt your head up a: How much you need to tilt your head up and down to reach the edges of the screen.
How much you need to tilt your head up o: How much you need to tilt your head up or down to reach the edge of the screen.
If enabled, Tracky Mouse will automatica: If enabled, Tracky Mouse will automatically check for updates when it starts.
If enabled, Tracky Mouse will automatically start when you log into your computer.
If enabled, Tracky Mouse will start cont: If enabled, Tracky Mouse will start controlling the cursor as soon as it's launched.
If enabled, you can start or stop mouse: If enabled, you can start or stop mouse control by holding both your eyes shut for a few seconds.
Locks mouse movement during the start of: Locks mouse movement during the start of a click to prevent accidental dragging.
Locks mouse movement for the given durat:
Locks mouse movement for the given duration during the start of a click.
You may want to turn this off if you're drawing on a canvas, or increase it if you find yourself accidentally dragging when you try to click.
Makes the cursor move extra fast for qui: Makes the cursor move extra fast for quick head movements, and extra slow for slow head movements. Helps to stabilize the cursor.
Makes the cursor move relatively fast fo:
Makes the cursor move relatively fast for quick head movements, and relatively slow for slow head movements.
Helps to stabilize the cursor. However, when using point tracking in combination with head tilt, a lower value may work better since head tilt is linear, and you want the point tracking to roughly match the head tracking for it to act as a seamless auto- calibration.
Makes Tracky Mouse active as soon as it': Makes Tracky Mouse active as soon as it's launched.
Makes Tracky Mouse active when launched. Otherwise, you can start it manually when you're ready.
Makes Tracky Mouse start automatically w: Makes Tracky Mouse start automatically when you log into your computer.
Minimum distance to move the cursor in o: Minimum distance to move the cursor in one frame, in pixels. Helps to fully stop the cursor.
Movement less than this distance in pixe: Movement less than this distance in pixels will be ignored.
No camera found. Please make sure you ha: No camera found. Please make sure you have a camera connected and enabled.
Notifies you of new versions of Tracky M: Notifies you of new versions of Tracky Mouse.
Notifies you when a new version of Track: Notifies you when a new version of Tracky Mouse is available.
Open mouth to click (with eye modifiers): Open mouth to click (with eye modifiers)
Open your camera's system settings windo: Open your camera's system settings window to adjust properties like brightness and contrast.
Open your mouth wide to click. At least: Open your mouth wide to click. At least one eye must be open to click.
Open your mouth wide to click. Eye state: Open your mouth wide to click. Eye state is ignored.
Open your mouth wide to click. If left e: Open your mouth wide to click. If left eye is closed, it's a right click; if right eye is closed, it's a middle click.
Opens the system settings dialog for the: Opens the system settings dialog for the selected camera, to adjust properties like auto-focus and auto-exposure.
Opens the system settings window for you: Opens the system settings window for your camera to adjust properties like auto-focus and auto-exposure.
Outputs the current value of an option.
Permission denied. Please enable access: Permission denied. Please enable access to the camera.
Please make sure no other programs are u: Please make sure no other programs are using the camera and try again.
Range of horizontal head tilt that moves: Range of horizontal head tilt that moves the cursor from one side of the screen to the other.
Range of vertical head tilt required to: Range of vertical head tilt required to move the cursor from the top to the bottom of the screen.
Select which camera to use for head trac: Select which camera to use for head tracking.
Selects which camera is used for head tr: Selects which camera is used for head tracking.
Something went wrong accessing the camer: Something went wrong accessing the camera.
Something went wrong accessing the camera. Please try again.
Speed in pixels/frame required to move t: Speed in pixels/frame required to move the cursor.
Speed of cursor movement in response to: Speed of cursor movement in response to horizontal head movement.
Speed of cursor movement in response to vertical head movement.
Switches the left and right mouse button:
Switches the left and right mouse buttons.
Useful if your system's mouse buttons are swapped.
Could also be used to right click with the dwell clicker in a pinch.
The previously selected camera is not av: The previously selected camera is not available. Try selecting "Default" for Video > Camera source, and then select a specific camera if you need to.
Webcam does not support the required res: Webcam does not support the required resolution. Please change your settings.
Webcam is already in use. Please make su: Webcam is already in use. Please make sure you have no other programs using the camera.
Will resume after mouse stops moving.
You can control your entire computer wit: You can control your entire computer with the TrackyMouse desktop app.
